benchmarks.label: iOS TestFlight Ready
benchmarks.description: Core VPN works, 1 protocol stable, basic UI

benchmarks.label: iOS App Store Ready
benchmarks.description: 2 protocols, kill switch, IAP, Privacy Policy, ToS

benchmarks.label: Android Play Store Ready
benchmarks.description: Android app feature parity with iOS launch

tasks.name: WireGuard Protocol — Production Stable
tasks.status: PRODUCTION WORKING. Peer registration fixed (was calling wrong server). JWT 401 auto-refresh implemented in APIClient. Config caching implemented in ServerService. Needs: auto-reconnect on network change, long-duration stability test.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Connect to WireGuard server and maintain stable connection for 60 seconds with zero packet loss
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: WireGuard connects to NL server, internet works, IP shows 178.62.101.221

acceptanceCriteria.test: JWT token refresh on 401 response — token is silently refreshed without disconnecting tunnel
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: JWT auto-refresh on 401 working — no disconnect during active tunnel

acceptanceCriteria.test: WireGuard config cached locally — reconnect to same server uses cached config, no API call required
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Config caching working — reconnect uses cached config

acceptanceCriteria.test: Tunnel handles network interruption — auto-reconnects within 3 seconds of WiFi/cellular switch
No app crashes during 300-second continuous connection + disconnect cycle test

tasks.name: IKEv2 Protocol — Production Stable
tasks.status: PRODUCTION WORKING. Server cert regenerated, ipsec.conf fixed, FORWARD/NAT rules added, CA CN mismatch fixed in iOS. All 3 auth methods work (cert, password, shared secret). Status observer handles both WireGuard and IKEv2.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Connect to IKEv2 server — NEVPNManager establishes tunnel without error
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: IKEv2 connects to NL server via strongSwan

acceptanceCriteria.test: VPNConnectionManager.statusObserver monitors NEVPNManager status changes and updates UI in real-time
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Status observer shows IKEv2 connection state in UI

acceptanceCriteria.test: Backend /servers/{id}/ikev2-config endpoint returns valid IKEv2 config with server IP, pre-shared key, and encryption settings
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Backend returns valid IKEv2 config with correct remoteId and password

acceptanceCriteria.test: Maintain IKEv2 connection for 60 seconds with zero packet loss
Switch from WireGuard to IKEv2 protocol and back without app crash or connection leak
App displays correct protocol name and connection status for IKEv2 in connection UI
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Protocol name and status displayed correctly for IKEv2

tasks.name: OpenVPN Protocol — iOS Client
tasks.status: NOT IMPLEMENTED. Server configured on port 1194 but iOS throws notImplemented error. DECISION: Hide from protocol picker in v1.0. Ship WireGuard + IKEv2 only. Post-launch feature.
tasks.blocker: Deferred to post-launch. WireGuard + IKEv2 sufficient for v1.0

acceptanceCriteria.test: OpenVPNAdapter SPM dependency added to Xcode project and builds without errors
User selects OpenVPN protocol in UI and app fetches /servers/{id}/openvpn-config successfully
OpenVPN tunnel connects and maintains connection for 60 seconds with zero packet loss
Protocol picker displays OpenVPN as selectable option alongside WireGuard and IKEv2
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Deferred post-launch — NEEDS REAL DEVICE VALIDATION

acceptanceCriteria.test: Switch from OpenVPN to another protocol disconnects cleanly without app crash

tasks.name: Internet Kill Switch
tasks.status: IMPLEMENTED. KillSwitchManager.swift supports Soft + Strict modes via NEOnDemandRule. Trusted networks list. UserDefaults persistence. Needs: UI mode selection (Soft vs Strict), fix silent failure when no VPN config exists.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Kill switch toggle present in Settings view and persists across app restarts
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Kill switch toggle present in Settings

acceptanceCriteria.test: When kill switch enabled and tunnel disconnects, all internet traffic is blocked — user cannot access internet without VPN
With kill switch enabled, WiFi/cellular switch maintains traffic block until tunnel reconnects
Kill switch disabled allows internet traffic without VPN — verified with network monitoring
App does not crash during rapid kill switch toggle cycles (10+ toggles in 5 seconds)

tasks.name: Auto-Reconnect on Network Change
tasks.status: PARTIAL. Auto-connect toggle exists in settings UI but is hardcoded (.constant(true)). No app-launch handler reads setting. No NWPathMonitor for network change detection.

acceptanceCriteria.test: NWPathMonitor initializes on app launch and monitors network status changes
Switch from WiFi to cellular network — tunnel auto-reconnects within 5 seconds
Switch from cellular to WiFi — tunnel auto-reconnects within 5 seconds
During network transition, user is notified of reconnect status (not silent)
Auto-reconnect can be disabled in settings and respects user preference

tasks.name: StoreKit 2 In-App Purchases
tasks.status: CRITICAL: StoreKit 2 framework built (SubscriptionManager 1144 lines, 6 tiers, transaction listener). BUT loading 0 products from App Store — likely bundle ID mismatch or products not approved in ASC. No server-side receipt validation. Revenue leak risk.
tasks.blocker: StoreKit returns 0 products. No backend receipt validation endpoint.

acceptanceCriteria.test: All 6 subscription tiers (Free, Weekly, Monthly, 6-Month, Yearly, Lifetime) display in subscription picker
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: 0 products loading from App Store

acceptanceCriteria.test: User completes purchase for any tier — StoreKit 2 payment sheet launches and transaction succeeds
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Blocked by 0 products

acceptanceCriteria.test: Backend endpoint POST /payments/validate-receipt receives transaction ID and validates receipt signature with Apple
After successful payment, user entitlements sync to app within 5 seconds — user immediately gains access to paid features
App handles subscription renewal — user stays subscribed after auto-renewal without re-authenticating
App displays accurate subscription status (active/expired/canceled) matching AppStore subscription data

tasks.name: Subscription Page — High-Conversion Redesign
tasks.status: IMPLEMENTED. PaywallView fully redesigned: brand palette, plan cards, badges (MOST POPULAR, BEST VALUE), savings %, trust signals, feature comparison matrix, gradient CTA. Logo 30% larger, consistent spacing. Needs: StoreKit product loading fix.

acceptanceCriteria.test: All 6 subscription tiers rendered as distinct cards with tier name, price, billing cycle visible
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: PaywallView displays with brand palette and plan cards

acceptanceCriteria.test: One tier marked as 'Most Popular' or 'Best Value' with visual highlight (color, badge, or border)
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Badges show MOST POPULAR, BEST VALUE correctly

acceptanceCriteria.test: Savings percentage calculated and displayed relative to monthly price (e.g., 'Save 50%')
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Savings percentages calculated and shown

acceptanceCriteria.test: Feature list displayed under each tier showing included features or feature comparison table present
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Trust signals grid visible

acceptanceCriteria.test: Trust signals visible (30-day money-back guarantee, encryption badge, or server count)
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Trust signals (guarantee, encryption, servers) displayed — NEEDS REAL DEVICE VALIDATION

acceptanceCriteria.test: Layout renders correctly in dark mode and light mode — no text contrast failures
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Logo displays at 104x104 (30% larger)

acceptanceCriteria.test: Page loads without crash on iPhone SE through iPhone 15 Pro Max (test 5 device sizes)
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: User-verified on real device: Consistent 12pt spacing between plan cards

tasks.name: Real-Time Bandwidth Monitoring
tasks.status: Backend BandwidthController exists with usage/history/alerts. iOS needs real-time speed display + data usage widget.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Connection UI displays real-time download speed (Mbps) updated every 1 second
Connection UI displays real-time upload speed (Mbps) updated every 1 second
Backend endpoint GET /bandwidth/usage returns current session data usage (uploaded + downloaded bytes)
Bandwidth history available — app shows daily/weekly data usage breakdown
Data usage does not include VPN tunnel protocol overhead — only user traffic counted
Speed display handles low-speed connections (< 1 Mbps) without crashing or display anomalies

acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Code exists, needs production validation

acceptanceCriteria.test: Real-time monitoring dashboard displays server load, connection count, bandwidth usage, uptime percentage

acceptanceCriteria.test: Admin dashboard loads in <2 seconds with all widgets populated
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Code exists, needs production validation

acceptanceCriteria.test: Role-based access control — admin vs operator vs viewer roles enforced

tasks.name: Admin — Real-Time IP Blocking & Rotation
tasks.status: Admin panel has basic server management. Need: real-time blocked IP detection dashboard, one-click IP rotation, automated IP reputation scoring, blocklist import from GFW/ISP databases, IP health monitoring.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Admin can view list of all VPN server IPs with block status per country
One-click IP rotation triggers new IP allocation and DNS update within 5 minutes
Automated IP health check runs every 15 min — alerts admin when IP is blocked in target country
Bulk blocklist import from CSV/JSON — GFW, Saudi, UAE blocklist formats supported
IP reputation score displayed (0-100) based on blocklist presence, age, abuse reports
Historical log of all IP blocks/rotations with timestamps and triggering country

tasks.name: Admin — Threat Detection & Security Dashboard
tasks.status: Backend has AI threat intelligence endpoints. Admin needs: real-time threat feed, brute force attempt visualization, geographic anomaly map, automated response rules, DDoS detection.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Real-time threat feed shows active attacks with source IP, type, and severity
Brute force detection dashboard shows failed auth attempts per IP with auto-ban threshold
Geographic anomaly map highlights suspicious login patterns (e.g., same account from 3 countries in 1 hour)
Automated response rules — admin can set: if >10 failed logins from IP in 5min → ban for 24h
DDoS detection shows traffic spike alerts with bandwidth graphs
One-click incident response: block IP range, rotate affected server keys, notify affected users

tasks.name: Admin — Infrastructure Health & Auto-Scaling
tasks.status: Admin has basic server CRUD. Need: real-time CPU/RAM/bandwidth graphs per server, disk alerts, auto-restart on crash, one-click server provisioning from admin UI, certificate expiry warnings.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Real-time CPU, RAM, disk, bandwidth graphs per server with 1-min granularity
Alert rules fire when CPU >80%, RAM >85%, disk >90%, or cert expires in <7 days
Auto-restart: if API/VPN service crashes, systemd restarts within 30 seconds — admin gets notification
One-click server provisioning from admin UI triggers Terraform/Ansible pipeline
Certificate status dashboard shows all TLS certs with expiry dates and auto-renew status
Server comparison view — side-by-side performance of all servers for capacity planning

tasks.name: Admin — Advanced User Management & Analytics
tasks.status: Admin has user list, subscription management, device management. Need: user session tracking, bandwidth per user, suspicious activity flagging, bulk operations, user export.

acceptanceCriteria.test: User detail page shows active sessions, connected server, protocol, bandwidth used
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Code exists, needs production validation

acceptanceCriteria.test: Suspicious activity flag auto-triggers on: shared credentials (5+ devices), bandwidth abuse (>500GB/mo)
Bulk operations: mass email, subscription change, account disable for selected users
User export to CSV with filters (plan type, signup date, country, bandwidth usage)
User analytics dashboard: signups/day, active users, churn rate, ARPU, LTV

tasks.name: Admin — Censorship Response Command Center
tasks.status: Not built. This is the CRITICAL tool for fighting censorship. Need: country-level block status dashboard, automated DPI detection, emergency protocol rotation, user notification system for affected regions, fallback domain management.

acceptanceCriteria.test: Country dashboard shows block status per protocol per country (green/yellow/red matrix)
Automated DPI probe: admin clicks 'Test' on a country → system probes from that country's network and reports which protocols pass
Emergency protocol rotation: one-click switches all users in a blocked country to working protocol
User notification system: push notification to all users in affected country with instructions
Fallback domain management: maintain list of backup domains/IPs, auto-switch when primary is blocked
Censorship event log: timestamped history of all block events, responses taken, and resolution time

tasks.name: In-App Support Ticket System
tasks.status: SupportTicket model exists in backend. Admin panel has support tickets page. iOS SupportView.swift exists with form UI. Need: API integration, ticket status tracking.

acceptanceCriteria.test: iOS SupportView.swift form captures category, subject, and description from user input
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Code exists, needs production validation

acceptanceCriteria.test: POST /support/tickets endpoint receives ticket data and creates record in database
User receives ticket ID confirmation immediately after submission
Admin panel displays all submitted tickets with filters by status (open/in-progress/resolved/closed)
acceptanceCriteria.evidence: Code exists, needs production validation

acceptanceCriteria.test: Admin can update ticket status and add support responses visible to user in app
User receives push notification when ticket status changes
Closed tickets archived and not shown in active ticket list

verificationPolicy.rule: Task progress is CALCULATED from acceptance criteria pass rate. No manual override.

self.label: Self-Reported
self.description: Department claims it works. NOT verified independently. Dashboard shows yellow.

tested.label: Tested
tested.description: Tested by QA or another department. Reproducible test evidence exists.

verified.label: CEO Verified
verified.description: CEO or designated reviewer confirmed it works in production/TestFlight.

rules: Progress % is auto-calculated: (criteria passed / total criteria) × 100
Unchecking a criterion immediately reduces progress — no sticky 100%
Self-reported criteria (tier 1) count toward progress but are flagged yellow
P0 tasks require at least 'tested' tier on all criteria before counting as done
App Store submission requires 'verified' tier on ALL P0 task criteria
CEO can uncheck any criterion — progress drops immediately
enforcementFlow: 1. Department checks criterion → marked 'self' (yellow) → progress updates
2. QA or cross-dept validates → marked 'tested' (blue) → higher trust
3. CEO confirms in TestFlight/production → marked 'verified' (green) → truly done
4. If real-world failure found → CEO unchecks → progress drops → task reopened

docker.notes: Docker Engine, containers for API + admin + website

servers.bottleneck: RAM is the constraint — 70% used. Adding more services (Prometheus/Grafana) will require upgrade to 8GB plan ($48/mo) or offloading DB to managed service.
recommendations: Upgrade to 8GB RAM droplet before adding monitoring stack
Move PostgreSQL to managed database when >1000 users ($15/mo)
Consider separating VPN traffic from API on different servers for scale

summary.riskLevel: HIGH — everything on one server. DB, API, VPN, website all share 4GB RAM.
summary.expansionPlan: 29 Terraform/Ansible files ready. provision.sh (850 lines) can deploy US, UK, DE, JP, SG, AU, CA, FR, BR nodes.

accessControl.note: This password protects the Infrastructure tab from casual viewing. Change periodically.

antiCensorship.currentCapability: Standard WireGuard/IKEv2/OpenVPN — BLOCKABLE by DPI in KSA/UAE

ghostMode.description: TLS fingerprint rotation, packet padding, timing jitter, decoy traffic

domainFronting.description: Cloudflare CDN, SNI manipulation, backup ports

antiCensorship.interimSolution: OpenVPN with obfs4 proxy OR IKEv2 on port 443

aiFeatures.name: AI Server Selection
aiFeatures.description: 8 modes (Auto/Speed/Security/Streaming/Gaming/Privacy/LowLatency/P2P). AIServerSelector.swift 200+ lines. Scoring + confidence. Needs real data feed.

aiFeatures.name: AI Threat Detection
aiFeatures.description: Backend ThreatIntelligence model + AIController endpoints. Geographic anomaly detection, brute force detection. Needs ML model training.

aiFeatures.name: AI Support Bot
aiFeatures.description: LLM-powered ticket resolution. SupportView exists in iOS. Backend SupportTicket model exists.

aiFeatures.name: AI Content Engine
aiFeatures.description: Blog CMS built, category auto-detect API exists. Can auto-generate SEO content.

aiFeatures.name: AI Test Generation
aiFeatures.description: Auto-generate test cases from code changes.

aiFeatures.name: AI Protocol Auto-Switch
aiFeatures.description: CasperCloak config has auto_switch: true. Switches between stealth/speed/resilient based on network conditions.

aiFeatures.name: AI Privacy Score
aiFeatures.description: Backend has /ai/privacy/score endpoint. Privacy scoring system based on leak tests, configuration analysis.

aiFeatures.name: AI Network Optimization
aiFeatures.description: Backend has /ai/network/metrics and /ai/network/throttling endpoints. ISP throttling detection.

aiFeatures.name: White-Label AI Customization
aiFeatures.description: AI-powered branding for white-label partners. Auto-generates branded assets.

crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: iOS adds ToS link to Settings view and App Store submission

crossDeptTasks.title: Implement Internet Kill Switch
crossDeptTasks.description: KillSwitchManager.swift implemented with Soft+Strict modes. Needs UI mode selection.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: QA validates kill switch blocks internet, survives network switches, rapid toggle cycles

crossDeptTasks.title: StoreKit 2 receipt validation + entitlement sync
crossDeptTasks.description: SubscriptionManager built (1144 lines). Need: backend POST /payments/validate-receipt receives transaction ID, validates with Apple, syncs entitlements to app within 5 seconds.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: Backend implements /payments/validate-receipt endpoint for Apple receipt validation

crossDeptTasks.title: Backend API: rate limiting + error standardization
crossDeptTasks.description: Add rate limiting on auth endpoints (5 req/sec per IP, 429 response). Standardize all error responses with error code, message, timestamp. These are the last 2 criteria blocking backend-api completion.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: QA load-tests rate limiting and validates error response format

crossDeptTasks.title: Stripe: real keys + webhook verification + lifecycle sync
crossDeptTasks.description: Switch to real Stripe keys. Implement webhook signature verification. Sync subscription lifecycle (renewal, failure, cancellation) to database. Test checkout end-to-end.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: iOS StoreKit connects to validated Stripe backend for web purchases

crossDeptTasks.title: ASO: App Store metadata, screenshots, preview video
crossDeptTasks.description: Optimize app name (30 chars, primary keyword), subtitle (30 chars, secondary keyword), keywords (100 chars high-volume), description (4000 chars with CTA). Create 6.7" and 5.5" screenshots of actual app UI. Record 30-second preview video of VPN connect flow at 1080p.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: iOS uploads metadata and screenshots to App Store Connect

crossDeptTasks.title: Subscription page redesign spec
crossDeptTasks.description: Design high-conversion subscription page: card-based tiers, 'Best Value' badge, savings percentages, feature comparison, trust signals (30-day guarantee, encryption badge). Dark mode variant. Spec must include spacing/sizing for SwiftUI implementation.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: iOS implements spec in SwiftUI SubscriptionView.swift

crossDeptTasks.title: FreeRADIUS end-to-end test + accounting
crossDeptTasks.description: RADIUS on port 1812. RadiusAuthController exists. Need: end-to-end auth flow test (iOS connects → RADIUS validates → Accept/Reject), RADIUS accounting Start/Stop messages logged per session, connection duration + traffic tracked.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: Backend queries RADIUS logs and reports per-user connection history

crossDeptTasks.title: CI/CD Pipeline — GitHub Actions
crossDeptTasks.description: Set up: iOS build on push to dropbox-local → run unit tests → upload to TestFlight. Backend Docker build → push to registry → deploy on main push. Admin panel build + deploy. Status badges on README. Failure notifications.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: QA validates pipeline catches test failures and deploys correctly

crossDeptTasks.title: Auto-Reconnect on network change
crossDeptTasks.description: Implement NWPathMonitor to detect WiFi↔Cellular transitions. Auto-reconnect tunnel within 5 seconds. Show reconnect status to user. Toggleable in settings.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: QA tests WiFi→cellular and cellular→WiFi transitions

crossDeptTasks.title: Password reset UI + deep link handling
crossDeptTasks.description: Backend has /auth/forgot-password and /auth/reset-password. Need: forgot password button on login → email confirmation screen → deep link handling for reset token → new password UI with validation → login with new password.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: QA tests full reset flow including expired/invalid tokens

crossDeptTasks.title: Onboarding flow — 3 screens + VPN permission
crossDeptTasks.description: Create 3-screen intro tutorial (privacy benefits → speed/performance → security/protection). Forward/backward navigation + skip button. VPN permission prompt after tutorial. Optional sign-up. Show only once per device.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: Marketing provides copy and visuals for each onboarding screen

crossDeptTasks.title: Website: SEO meta tags + download pages + Lighthouse 90+
crossDeptTasks.description: Add SEO meta tags (title, description, keywords) to all 26+ pages. Create download pages for iOS, Android, macOS, Windows, Linux with correct app links. Add Open Graph tags for social sharing. Optimize for Lighthouse 90+ Performance and SEO.
crossDeptTasks.handoffNote: Marketing validates SEO meta tags match target keyword strategy
